title_welcome: Welcome to StatWarhammer40k platform for desktop!

accueil.intro: This platform allows you to simulate damage for your Warhammer 40k units against various targets. Whether you're building your army list or mid-game, you can quickly estimate the potential damage a unit can deal to a specific target. The platform adapts its layout depending on whether it is opened on a computer or a phone, making it easy to use in any situation.

generic.mono_text: Simulate an attack from one attack profile against one defense profile.
generic.multi_text: Simulate an attack from a unit containing multiple different attack profiles (e.g., a leader with bodyguards, a unit with special weapons, etc.).
generic.comparateur_text: Compare two attack profiles on a variety of target profiles to find the best profile for the role you want to give your unit (anti-infantry, anti-tank, etc.).
generic.predef_text: Simulate an attack from an attack profile against a defense profile taken from a predefined database of Warhammer 40k 10th edition unit profiles. The data used for predefined units on this page comes from the open-source project BSData/wh40k-10e ‚Äî

custom.listes_text: Save and manage your personal attack profile lists so you can quickly access them during your games.
custom.adverses_text: Prepare lists of common enemy profiles to save time during in-game simulations.
custom.calcul_text: Quickly simulate an attack from a unit in your list against a predefined defensive unit.

accueil.connexion: Login is required to create and manage your personal profiles. It generates a username and password linked to a database that you create yourself. Your email address is not shared with anyone. The account only serves to generate login credentials to manage data access, ensuring that each user can access their own unit profiles only.

remarque.formats: The "Attacks" and "Damage" fields can include random values using D6 or D3 in the profile. Just write text like "XD6+Y" or "XD3+Y".
remarque.calcul: The background calculation is a simulation of 1000 attack sequences. Each sequence simulates a series of dice rolls including hits, wounds, saves, and potential Feel No Pain rolls. This gives a list of 1000 results, from which the average and standard deviation can be calculated.

accueil.don_text: This site is completely free to use, but hosting it comes at a cost for the developer. The project cannot continue without community donations and will be forced to shut down without regular support. If you want to support the project, you can make a donation!
accueil.contact_text: Feel free to send me a message if you have feedback, questions, or want to report any issues while using the platform! You can use the box below to contact me directly.
